course.subject: SOSC
course.name: China's Sustainable Development
course.description: There is a great necessity and responsibility for China to shift to a more sustainable development path. This course is designed to provide students with an understanding of the concepts, principles, and evaluation methodologies of sustainable development. The course will introduce students to multidisciplinary approaches to apply these principles and methods to analyse sustainable development issues in China, such as energy resources and water pollution, transportation and urbanization, and climate change; and to explore solutions for China's future development. Governance and policy, technology, organizational and individual behavior are important elements affecting sustainable development and will be examined at international, national, and local levels.
course.prerequisites: ENVR 3110 OR SOSC 1170 OR SOSC 3150 OR SOSC 3180

reviews.author: Freedom
reviews.title: 千祈唔好讀
reviews.comment_content: 都係講啲環境嘢 完全冇底嘅話會唔知學咗咩
reviews.comment_teaching: 個大陸婆冇心教 英文又難聽 基本上堂堂都係學生present
reviews.comment_grading: 4字頭course嚟講好爛 正正常常做齊嘢 身邊都唔少人C range 自覺正正常常都係咁
reviews.comment_workload: 好重 好多個presentation 仲要交份十幾頁paper係關於環境

reviews.author: Serdtse
reviews.title: slightly heavy workload, but excellent grade
reviews.comment_content:
As the course title suggest, it mainly talk about Chinese environmental problems and environmental governance (e.g. regulations, public acceptance).

*I would say this course focuses more on air pollution. The content is not difficult.
reviews.comment_teaching:
- very nice prof

- always encourage in-class participation, no matter you just make a response or ask some relevant questions (and she will try to remember your names). Actually i think instead of lectures, she likes class discussions much more

- very willing to answer students' questions

- when doing the group project, there's a consultation time, and she gives very helpful suggestions
reviews.comment_grading:
- Reading article review presentation 15%
- Leading discussion 10%
- Group Project 25%
- Individual paper and presentation 35%

- Attendance and class participation 15%

Mine:
- review presentation (I didn't do well in this, and scored a bit below mean)

- discussion (about mean, I forgot)

- project (above mean)

- individual paper (haha, because I didn't do well in the present & discuss, this one I put full effort and scored 90%)

- attendance (I missed 3 classes. BUT, I asked questions and made responses in class. Oh, and don't try to ask yr friends to sign for you because it's a small class, the prof and ta probably recognize you)

Final Grade: A
reviews.comment_workload:
Reading article review presentation
- article length: depends on yr luck;
- presentation: individual, 15 mins

Leading discussion
- 5 mins response to the person who review the article --> you think of at least 2-3 questions
-  lead a 10 mins class discussion

Group Project
- this semester is to do a factsheet postser
- group of 3 (groupmates are randomly assigned)

Individual paper and presentation
- presentation: 5 mins, just tell the prof and ta what you're gonna do
- 15 pgs, double-spaced, charts/tables/graphs/pictures not included in page count, those are put in appendix

** The workload might seems a bit heavy, but it's not that difficult. Most importantly, there's no midterm/ final and effort do pay off.

reviews.author: alexchw
reviews.title: The grade is a little bit harsh and a bit out of the expectation
reviews.comment_content: 內容其實還可以，reading也不算悶，也圍繞sustainability的主題。但最大的問題可能就是，從閱讀材料中領悟到幾多，全憑自己，課堂只有學生針對閱讀材料的present和discussion，但反應不算熱烈，而且沒有很多的指引導向，令到我們根本不知道自己所領悟到的是否符合教授的期望。
reviews.comment_teaching: 很普通，她有一點過分則重時間於學生的匯報上，就是有時候學生的匯報佔了課堂接近9成的時間，這好像太誇張了，她不是沒有心，而是整件事呈現出來顯得有點佛系吧！
reviews.comment_grading:
我就覺得等級而言很殘酷，
15% A
35% B
40% C
這個和學校最寬鬆的要求相比還是有距離，加上小班的情況之下，結果A只有2個人，但我感覺到大家都很努力，那就為什麼不可以在情況許可下給予大家一個好成績？
我B-range，一定和預期有落差吧，沒辦法。
reviews.comment_workload: 如果等級是這樣的話，我覺得workload真的很重，尤其是Paper上

reviews.author: freehk
reviews.comment_content: It covers different environmental issue in China and how the governance of China would influence the execution of environmental policies.
reviews.comment_teaching: It's a 9 am class, many students start skipping lecture since week 4/5. However, attendance is counted for 15%. So you'd better attend it. The prof. is nice, she is willing to give advice and answer our questions in details.
reviews.comment_grading:
- Peer-essay Review
- Discussion
- Poster (Group project)
- Final essay
- Final essay presentation

(All above mean except group project)
reviews.comment_workload: A bit heavy but still acceptable for a 4000 course. Better save more time to prepare your final essay, it's very important!!!

reviews.author: hihihibye
reviews.title: slightly heavy work load, but hard work pays off
reviews.comment_content: a brief teaching in all the the china envr problems and how china deal with it. Just a brief~
reviews.comment_teaching:
learn a lot of China envr policies and the current china envr problem.

She encourage class interaction! Nice prof!
reviews.comment_grading:
Though class parti literally is 10 % , I think it greatly affect your grade
Reading article review presentation 15
Leading discussion 10
Project 25
Individual paper and presentation 35
Attendance and class participation 10
reviews.comment_workload:
still acceptable as it is a 4000 level sosc course, but slightly heavy for me! need to write a 15 pages essay, and 2 presentation and one group proj.

No exam!

reviews.author: Khanopy
reviews.comment_content: The content is very similar to SOSC1170 as mentioned  by other reviewers. Not difficult at all. Interesting topics. Professor welcomes discussions.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The teaching was not perfect, but still acceptable.
Professor explained concepts clearly and encouraged discussions among students.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is very good for a SOSC4K-level course. Active class participation and discussion is the key to success. You will need to show a strong interest in topics discussed and give constructive comments. Also, you teammates play an important role as some work has to be done in a group.
reviews.comment_workload: Acceptable. You efforts paid off. Good luck!

reviews.author: Sajangnim
reviews.comment_content: First of all, the content of the course is very similar to the content of the prerequisite course SOSC 1170. To be honest, I could only spot some few differences comparing the two courses' content. What really differs from the previous course was the articles required for us to read and review, as well as the personal research paper.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching was average, content delivery was clear but not super interesting. I wish there are more guidance for the final research work.
reviews.comment_grading: Grade was good for me, but some bad for others. I believe the final grade depends heavily on the frequency of discussion participation as well as other graded components.
reviews.comment_workload: Minimum workload for the beginning of the course, but more in the later part due to presentations and research. No mid-term no finals suits my style.
